description.narrative: The development objective of the Project is to support the Borrower (the Moroccan Solar Agency MASEN) in the development of the 500Megawatt Ouarzazate solar power plant by financing the first phase (160 Megawatt gross) through a public private partnership (PPP),to increase power generation from solar power and mitigate greenhouse gas emissions and local environment impact

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :All other agreements, to be found satisfactory bythe World Bank in form and substance within reasonable time, required to finance,construct, own, and operate the Plant, including,but not limited to:1. the EPC Contract;2. the O&M Agreement;3. the PPA;4. thePower Sale Agreement;5. the Shareholders'Agreement;6. the Transmission Interconnection Agreement; and7. the Grid Access Agreement. | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :Execution and satisfaction of all conditionsprecedent to the effectiveness and, to the extent applicable, to the right of the Borrower to make withdrawals under them (otherthan the effectiveness of this Agreement), of all the following co-financing agreements with:1. the AFD;2. the AfDB;3. theEC;4. the EIB;5. the KfW. | Due Date :12-Jun-2013
Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower and the Kingdom of Morocco haveentered into the Project Specific Convention | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower and the Project Implementing Entityhave adopted the Financial Management and Disbursement Manual, satisfactory to theWorld Bank and the Co-financiers | Due Date:12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower and the Project Implementing Entityhave adopted the Governance Framework, satisfactory to the World Bank | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower and the Project Implementing Entityhave established an accounting and financial management system satisfactory to theWorld Bank | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The IBRD Loan Agreement has been executed anddelivered and all conditions precedent to its effectiveness and to the right of the Borrower to make withdrawals under it (otherthan the effectiveness of this Agreement) have been satisfied or waived | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Project Implementing Entity has been legallyestablished in a manner satisfactory to the World Bank | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Subsidiary Loan Agreements have been executedon behalf of the Borrower and the Project Implementing Entity and all conditions precedent to their effectiveness and to the rightof the Project Implementing Entity to make withdrawals under them (other than the effectiveness of this Agreement) have beensatisfied or waived | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Article Vsection 5.01 of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The subsidiary of MASEN, MASEN Capital, has beenlegally established in a manner satisfactory to the World Bank | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IA,paragraph 4of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall contract anindependent verification expert, satisfactory to the World Bank, under terms of reference satisfactory to the World Bank, to carryout technical audits and prepare the technical audit reports regarding the implementation of Part 1.Aof the Project, and of the EPCContract referred to in Section II.B.3 of this Schedule 2 to this Agreement. | Due Date :01-Nov-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IB,paragraph 1of CTF Loan Agreement | Description :The Borrower shall make the proceeds ofthe Loan allocated from time to time to Category 1 of the table in Section IV.A.2 of this Schedule and the proceeds of the AFDCo-financing, the AfDB Co-financing I, the AfDB Co-financing II, the EIB Co-financing, and the KfW Co-financing I available to theProject Implementing Entity as a loan or loans under one or more subsidiary loan agreements | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :Not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, theBorrower shall providethe World Bank with a draft of the SDP for itscomments and recommendations . | Due Date :12-Sep-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :Notlater than eighteen (18) months after the Effective Date,the Borrower shall prepare areport on the implementation of the SDP and provide such report to the World Bankfor its comments andr | Due Date :12-Dec-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall cause ii) not toamend, suspend, abrogate,repeal or waive any provision of the ESIA or the LAPwithout prior consultation with, and approval of the World Bank. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project Implementing Entity: (i)to construct andoperate the Plant at all times in compliance with the ESIA and the LAP | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall disclose, and shall cause the ProjectImplementing Entity todisclose all relevant safeguard-related documentation regarding the Part 1 of theProject | Due Date:01-Sep-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall ensure that no works shall commence for anyAssociated Facilitybefore the implementation of a due diligence to assess any need for land acquisitionand/or involuntaryresettle | Due Date :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall: (i) cause the Project Implementing Entityto prepare and disclosean environmental and social management reporton a bi-annual basis during theconstruction of the Plant |Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF Loan | Description :The Borrower shall: (ii) include suchreport in the ProjectReports referred to in Section II.A of this Schedule 2 | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :The Borrower shall cause the Project ImplementingEntity not to authorize anycommencement of civil works to build the Plant beforean ESIA is prepared, adoptedand disclosed | DueDate :12-Jun-2013

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :The Borrower shall: (i) cause the ESIA including anESMP for the AssociatedFacilities to be developed in a manner consistent with the provisions of the FESIA; | Due Date :01-Sep-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :The Borrower shall: (i) maintain within the ProjectManagement Unit, anenvironmental and social safeguards unit including an environmental and socialsafeguard coordinator |Frequency:Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :The Borrower shall: (ii) (ii) cause the ProjectImplementing Entity to establish and maintain anenvironmental and social unit adequate to supervise the preparation of theESIA,further implement | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section IDof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :The Borrower shall: ii) provide the World Bank withthe relevant draft ESIA for any of theAssociated Facilities, allow the World Bank one month to provide its comments andfeedback |Due Date :01-Sep-2014

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section Vof CTF Loan | Description :Not later than the end of each fiscal year commencing with theBorrowerÃ¢Â€Â™s fiscalyear 2013, the Borrower shall furnish to the World Bank a copy of the business planand financialprojections| Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2,Section Vof CTF LoanAgreement | Description :Except agreed by the World Bank, the BorrowerÃ¢Â€Â™sEquity shall remainpositive on a yearly basis commencing with the BorrowerÃ¢Â€Â™s fiscal year 2012 | Frequency :Yearly
